nl: Let $f$ and $g$ be continuous mappings of a metric space $X$ into a metric space $Y$, and let $E$ be a dense subset of $X$. Prove that $f(E)$ is dense in $f(X)$.
lean:
∀ {α : Type} [MetricSpace α]
  {β : Type} [MetricSpace β]
  (f : α → β)
  (s : Set α)
  (h₁ : Continuous f)
  (h₂ : Dense s), f '' Set.univ ⊆ closure (f '' s)
candidate: ∀ {X Y : Type*} [MetricSpace X] [MetricSpace Y] {f g : X → Y} (hfg : ∀ x, ContinuousAt f x ∧ ContinuousAt g x) (E : Set X) (hE : Dense E), Dense (f '' E)
imports:
import Mathlib

open Topology Filter Real Complex TopologicalSpace Finset
open scoped BigOperators
